name: immitigable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not possible to be mitigated (= made less harmful, unpleasant, or bad): The project will not have a significant immitigable effect on the environment. The report referred to the immitigable nature of the adverse impact of businesses’ activities on human rights.
More examplesFewer examplesNatural gas pipelines in this region will result in permanent and immitigable harm to the environment.All of the alternative proposals will result in significant, immitigable impacts on downstream water users, both human and ecological.He describes the immitigable hardships, and the physical and mental agonies that these people have suffered.
